body_html:
Sorry to reopen this @apaszke but I'm having the same problem and I was wondering if this bug has been fixed.
I'm able to save and load models using torch.save(model, model_file) and model = torch.load(model_file) while working on a Jupyter notebook but if I run the same from a Python file, I'm getting this error.
TypeError: <module '__main__'> is a built-in class
body_text:
Sorry to reopen this @apaszke but I'm having the same problem and I was wondering if this bug has been fixed.
I'm able to save and load models using torch.save(model, model_file) and model = torch.load(model_file) while working on a Jupyter notebook but if I run the same from a Python file, I'm getting this error.
TypeError: <module '__main__'> is a built-in class
body:
Sorry to reopen this @apaszke but I'm having the same problem and I was wondering if this bug has been fixed.
I'm able to save and load models using `torch.save(model, model_file)` and `model = torch.load(model_file)` while working on a Jupyter notebook but if I run the same from a Python file, I'm getting this error.
`TypeError: <module '__main__'> is a built-in class`
